001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group;
008import squidpony.ArrayTools;
009import squidpony.IColorCenter;
010import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
011import squidpony.squidmath.OrderedSet;
012import squidpony.squidmath.SeededNoise;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Collection;
016
017import static com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils.clamp;
018
019/**
020 * A helper class to make using multiple SquidPanels easier.
021 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/6/2015.
022 */
023public class SquidLayers extends Group {
024    protected int width;
025    protected int height;
026    protected int cellWidth;
027    protected int cellHeight;
028    public int[][] lightnesses;
029    protected SquidPanel backgroundPanel, foregroundPanel;
030    protected ArrayList<SquidPanel> extraPanels;
031    protected TextCellFactory textFactory;
032    protected float animationDuration;
033
034    public static final char EMPTY_CELL = ' ';
035
036    /**
037     * The pixel width of the entire map as displayed.
038     *
039     * @return the pixel width of the entire map as displayed
040     */
041    @Override
042    public float getWidth() {
043        return width * cellWidth;
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * The pixel height of the entire map as displayed.
048     *
049     * @return the pixel height of the entire map as displayed
050     */
051    @Override
052    public float getHeight() {
053        return height * cellHeight;
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Width of the shown area of the map in grid cells.
058     *
059     * @return the width of the map in grid cells
060     */
061    public int getGridWidth() {
062        return width;
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Height of the shown area of the map in grid cells.
067     *
068     * @return the height of the map in grid cells
069     */
070    public int getGridHeight() {
071        return height;
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Width of one cell in pixels.
076     *
077     * @return the width of one cell in pixels
078     */
079    public int getCellWidth() {
080        return cellWidth;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Height of one cell in pixels.
085     *
086     * @return the height of one cell in pixels
087     */
088    public int getCellHeight() {
089        return cellHeight;
090    }
091
092    public float getAnimationDuration() {
093        return animationDuration;
094    }
095
096    public void setAnimationDuration(float animationDuration) {
097        this.animationDuration = animationDuration;
098    }
099
100    public TextCellFactory getTextFactory() {
101        return textFactory;
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Get the lightness modifiers used for background cells as an int[][], with elements between 0 and 511, 256 as the
106     * unmodified lightness level, lower numbers meaning darker, and higher meaning lighter.
107     *
108     * @return
109     */
110    public int[][] getLightnesses() {
111        return lightnesses;
112    }
113    /**
114     * Alters the lightnesses that affect the background colors, accepting a parameter for
115     * animation frame if rippling water and waving grass using {@link SeededNoise} are desired. It may make sense to
116     * pass some fraction of the current time, as given by {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}, instead of a frame.
117     * Does not allocate a new 2D int array like {@link MapUtility#generateLightnessModifiers(char[][])} or its
118     * equivalent in DungeonUtility, and directly mutates the lightness data. You can use the {@link #lightnesses} field
119     * to access the 2D array directly, where you can make further modifications to the lighting.
120     * @return this for chaining
121     */
122    public SquidLayers autoLight () {
123        return autoLight(1.2345, '~', ',');
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Alters the lightnesses that affect the background colors, accepting a parameter for
128     * animation frame if rippling water and waving grass using {@link SeededNoise} are desired. It may make sense to
129     * pass some fraction of the current time, as given by {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}, instead of a frame.
130     * Does not allocate a new 2D int array like {@link MapUtility#generateLightnessModifiers(char[][])} or its
131     * equivalent in DungeonUtility, and directly mutates the lightness data. You can use the {@link #lightnesses} field
132     * to access the 2D array directly, where you can make further modifications to the lighting.
133     * @param frame         a counter that typically should increase by between 10.0 and 20.0 each second; higher numbers make
134     *                      water and grass move more, and 0.013 multiplied by the current time in milliseconds works well
135     *                      as long as only the smaller digits of the time are used; this can be accomplished with
136     *                      {@code (System.currentTimeMillis() & 0xFFFFFF) * 0.013} .
137     * @return a 2D array of lightness values from -255 to 255 but usually close to 0; can be passed to SquidLayers
138     */
139    public SquidLayers autoLight (double frame) {
140        return autoLight(frame, '~', ',');
141    }
142    /**
143     * Alters the lightnesses that affect the background colors, accepting a parameter for
144     * animation frame if rippling water and waving grass using {@link SeededNoise} are desired. It may make sense to
145     * pass some fraction of the current time, as given by {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}, instead of a frame.
146     * Also allows additional chars to be treated like deep and shallow water regarding the ripple animation.
147     * Does not allocate a new 2D int array like {@link MapUtility#generateLightnessModifiers(char[][])} or its
148     * equivalent in DungeonUtility, and directly mutates the lightness data. You can use the {@link #lightnesses} field
149     * to access the 2D array directly, where you can make further modifications to the lighting.
150     * @param frame         a counter that typically should increase by between 10.0 and 20.0 each second; higher numbers make
151     *                      water and grass move more, and 0.013 multiplied by the current time in milliseconds works well
152     *                      as long as only the smaller digits of the time are used; this can be accomplished with
153     *                      {@code (System.currentTimeMillis() & 0xFFFFFF) * 0.013} .
154     * @param deepLiquid    a char that will be treated like deep water when animating ripples
155     * @param shallowLiquid a char that will be treated like shallow water when animating ripples
156     * @return a 2D array of lightness values from -255 to 255 but usually close to 0; can be passed to SquidLayers
157     */
158    public SquidLayers autoLight (double frame, char deepLiquid, char shallowLiquid) {
159        final char[][] map = foregroundPanel.contents;
160        final int w = getTotalWidth(), h = getTotalHeight();
161        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++) {
162            for (int j = 0; j < h; j++) {
163                switch (map[i][j]) {
164                    case '\1':
165                    case '├':
166                    case '┤':
167                    case '┴':
168                    case '┬':
169                    case '┌':
170                    case '┐':
171                    case '└':
172                    case '┘':
173                    case '│':
174                    case '─':
175                    case '┼':
176                    case '#':
177                        lightnesses[i][j] = 30;
178                        break;
179                    case '.':
180                    case ' ':
181                    case '\u0006':
182                        lightnesses[i][j] = 0;
183                        break;
184                    case ':':
185                        lightnesses[i][j] = -15;
186                        break;
187                    case '+':
188                    case '/':
189                        lightnesses[i][j] = -10;
190                        break;
191                    case ',':
192                        lightnesses[i][j] = (int) (85 * (SeededNoise.noise(i * 0.16, j * 0.16, frame * 0.05, 1234567) * 0.55 - 0.7));
193                        break;
194                    case '~':
195                        lightnesses[i][j] = (int) (100 * (SeededNoise.noise(i * 0.16, j * 0.16, frame * 0.05, 1234567) * 0.4 - 0.65));
196                        break;
197                    case '"':
198                        lightnesses[i][j] = (int) (95 * (SeededNoise.noise(i * 0.16, j * 0.16, frame * 0.05, 123456789) * 0.3 - 1.5));
199                        break;
200                    case '^':
201                        lightnesses[i][j] = 40;
202                        break;
203                    default:
204                        if (map[i][j] == deepLiquid)
205                            lightnesses[i][j] = (int) (180 * (SeededNoise.noise(i * 0.46, j * 0.46, frame * 0.041, 987654321) * 0.45 - 0.7));
206                        else if (map[i][j] == shallowLiquid)
207                            lightnesses[i][j] = (int) (110 * (SeededNoise.noise(i * 0.56, j * 0.56, frame * 0.061, 987654321) * 0.4 - 0.65));
208                        else lightnesses[i][j] = 0;
209                }
210            }
211        }
212        return this;
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Sets the lightness modifiers used for background cells with the int[][] passed as lightnesses. This 2D array
217     * should have elements between 0 to 511, with 256 as the unmodified lightness level, lower numbers meaning darker,
218     * and higher meaning lighter. Elements less than 0 or higher than 511 will probably cause array out-of-bounds
219     * exceptions to be thrown when this renders, so just don't do that. This doesn't validate because maps can get
220     * large, validating many cells could be expensive, and this might be called often if it's being called at all.
221     *
222     * @param lightnesses 2D array, width and height should match this class' gridWidth and gridHeight. elements must
223     *                    be between 0 and 511.
224     */
225    public void setLightnesses(int[][] lightnesses) {
226        this.lightnesses = lightnesses;
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with a default stretchable font, 40 cells wide and 40 cells high,
231     * and 12x12 pixels for each cell.
232     * <br>
233     * This uses a default font that is not supplied in the JAR library of SquidLib; you need two files to use it if it
234     * does not render correctly:
235     * <ul>
236     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.fnt</li>
237     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.png</li>
238     * </ul>
239     */
240    public SquidLayers() {
241        this(40, 40);
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with a default stretchable font, the given number of cells for gridWidth
246     * and gridHeight, and 12x12 pixels for each cell.
247     * <br>
248     * This uses a default font that is not supplied in the JAR library of SquidLib; you need two files to use it if it
249     * does not render correctly:
250     * <ul>
251     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.fnt</li>
252     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.png</li>
253     * </ul>
254     *
255     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
256     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
257     */
258    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight) {
259        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, 12, 12);
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with a default stretchable font (it will adapt to the cellWidth and cellHeight
264     * you give it), the given number of cells for gridWidth and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell
265     * given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
266     * <br>
267     * This uses a default font that is not supplied in the JAR library of SquidLib; you need two files to use it if it
268     * does not render correctly:
269     * <ul>
270     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.fnt</li>
271     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.png</li>
272     * </ul>
273     *
274     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
275     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
276     * @param cellWidth  in pixels
277     * @param cellHeight in pixels
278     */
279    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight) {
280        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, DefaultResources.getSCC(), DefaultResources.getSCC());
281    }

283    /**
284     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given path to a BitmapFont file, the given number of cells for gridWidth
285     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
286     *
287     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
288     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
289     * @param cellWidth  in pixels
290     * @param cellHeight in pixels
291     * @param fontpath   A path to a BitmapFont in the assets folder
292     */
293    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, String fontpath) {
294        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, fontpath,
295                DefaultResources.getSCC(), DefaultResources.getSCC());
296    }

299     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given path to a BitmapFont file, the given number of cells for gridWidth
300     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
301     *
302     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
303     * @param gridHeight in grid cells

305     * @param cellHeight in pixels
306     * @param bitmapFont A BitmapFont that you already constructed
307     */
308    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, BitmapFont bitmapFont) {
309        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, bitmapFont,
310                DefaultResources.getSCC(), DefaultResources.getSCC());

313    /**
314     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given path pre-constructed TextCellFactory, the given number of cells
315     * for gridWidth and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
316     * Consider using predefined TextCellFactory objects from {@link DefaultResources}, which will be configured by
317     * this constructor for sizing when passed here.
318     *
319     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
320     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
321     * @param cellWidth  in pixels
322     * @param cellHeight in pixels
323     * @param tcf        A TextCellFactory that you already constructed
324     */
325    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, TextCellFactory tcf) {
326        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, tcf,
327                DefaultResources.getSCC(), DefaultResources.getSCC());
328    }

330    /**
331     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with a default stretchable font (it will adapt to the cellWidth and cellHeight
332     * you give it), the given number of cells for gridWidth and gridHeight, the size in pixels for each cell
333     * given by cellWidth and cellHeight, and the given SquidColorCenter instances to affect colors.
334     * <br>
335     * This uses a default font that is not supplied in the JAR library of SquidLib; you need two files to use it if it
336     * does not render correctly:
337     * <ul>
338     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.fnt</li>
339     * <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.png</li>
340     * </ul>
341     *
342     * @param gridWidth     in grid cells
343     * @param gridHeight    in grid cells
344     * @param cellWidth     in pixels
345     * @param cellHeight    in pixels
346     * @param bgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the background
347     * @param fgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the foreground
348     */
349    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight,
350                       SquidColorCenter bgColorCenter, SquidColorCenter fgColorCenter) {
351        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, DefaultResources.getStretchableFont(),
352                bgColorCenter, fgColorCenter);
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given path to a BitmapFont file, the given number of cells for gridWidth
357     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
358     *
359     * @param gridWidth     in grid cells
360     * @param gridHeight    in grid cells
361     * @param cellWidth     in pixels
362     * @param cellHeight    in pixels
363     * @param fontpath      A path to a BitmapFont that can be on the classpath (in SquidLib) or in the assets folder.
364     * @param bgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the background
365     * @param fgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the foreground
366     */
367    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, String fontpath,
368                       SquidColorCenter bgColorCenter, SquidColorCenter fgColorCenter) {
369        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, new TextCellFactory().font(fontpath), bgColorCenter, fgColorCenter);
370    }
371
372    /**
373     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given BitmapFont (already constructed), the given number of cells for
374     * gridWidth and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
375     *
376     * @param gridWidth     in grid cells
377     * @param gridHeight    in grid cells
378     * @param cellWidth     in pixels
379     * @param cellHeight    in pixels
380     * @param bitmapFont    A BitmapFont that you already constructed
381     * @param bgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the background
382     * @param fgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the foreground
383     */
384    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, BitmapFont bitmapFont,
385                       SquidColorCenter bgColorCenter, SquidColorCenter fgColorCenter) {
386        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, new TextCellFactory().font(bitmapFont), bgColorCenter, fgColorCenter);
387    }
388
389    /**
390     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given TextCellFactory, the given number of cells for gridWidth
391     * and gridHeight, the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight, and the given
392     * SquidColorCenters for background and foreground. Consider using predefined TextCellFactory objects from
393     * {@link DefaultResources}, which will be configured by this constructor for sizing when passed here.
394     *
395     * @param gridWidth     in grid cells
396     * @param gridHeight    in grid cells
397     * @param cellWidth     in pixels
398     * @param cellHeight    in pixels
399     * @param tcf           A TextCellFactory that will be (re-)initialized here with the given cellHeight and cellWidth.
400     * @param bgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the background
401     * @param fgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the foreground
402     */
403    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, TextCellFactory tcf,
404                       SquidColorCenter bgColorCenter, SquidColorCenter fgColorCenter) {
405        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, cellWidth, cellHeight, tcf, bgColorCenter, fgColorCenter, null);
406    }
407
408    /**
409     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given TextCellFactory, the given number of cells for gridWidth
410     * and gridHeight, the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight, the given
411     * SquidColorCenters for background and foreground, and the given 2D char array for an area map that may be
412     * sized differently than gridWidth by gridHeight (it is usually larger than gridWidth by gridHeight, which
413     * allows camera scrolling across the map). This requires some special work with the Camera and Viewports to
414     * get working correctly; in the squidlib module's examples,
415     * <a href="https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/squidlib/src/test/java/squidpony/gdx/examples/EverythingDemo.java">EverythingDemo</a>
416     * may be a good place to see how this can be done. You can pass null for actualMap, which will simply create
417     * a char array to use internally that is exactly gridWidth by gridHeight, in cells. Consider using predefined
418     * TextCellFactory objects from {@link DefaultResources}, which will be configured by this constructor for
419     * sizing when passed here.
420     *
421     * @param gridWidth     in grid cells
422     * @param gridHeight    in grid cells
423     * @param cellWidth     in pixels
424     * @param cellHeight    in pixels
425     * @param tcf           A TextCellFactory that will be (re-)initialized here with the given cellHeight and cellWidth.
426     * @param bgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the background
427     * @param fgColorCenter a SquidColorCenter (possibly with a filter) to use for the foreground
428     * @param actualMap     will often be a different size than gridWidth by gridHeight, which enables camera scrolling
429     */
430    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, TextCellFactory tcf,
431                       SquidColorCenter bgColorCenter, SquidColorCenter fgColorCenter, char[][] actualMap) {
432        this.setTransform(false);
433
434        width = gridWidth;
435        height = gridHeight;
436
437        this.cellWidth = cellWidth;
438        this.cellHeight = cellHeight;
439        textFactory = tcf.width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight).initBySize();
440
441        if (actualMap == null || actualMap.length <= 0) {
442            backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, bgColorCenter);
443            foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, fgColorCenter);
444            lightnesses = new int[width][height];
445        } else {
446            backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, bgColorCenter, 0, 0, ArrayTools.fill(' ', actualMap.length, actualMap[0].length));
447            foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, fgColorCenter, 0, 0, actualMap);
448            lightnesses = new int[actualMap.length][actualMap[0].length];
449        }
450        animationDuration = foregroundPanel.DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION;
451
452        extraPanels = new ArrayList<>();
453
454        addActorAt(0, backgroundPanel);
455        addActorAt(2, foregroundPanel);
456
457        setSize(backgroundPanel.getWidth(), backgroundPanel.getHeight());
458    }
459
460    /**
461     * Add an extra layer on top of the foreground layer. Use putInto methods to specify the layer when adding a char (0
462     * is background, 1 is unused, 2 is foreground, and the first call to this method creates layer 3).
463     *
464     * @return this for chaining
465     */
466    public SquidLayers addExtraLayer() {
467        SquidPanel sp;
468        if (width != foregroundPanel.getTotalWidth() || height != foregroundPanel.getTotalHeight())
469            sp = new SquidPanel(width, height, textFactory, foregroundPanel.getColorCenter(), 0, 0,
470                    ArrayTools.fill(' ', foregroundPanel.getTotalWidth(), foregroundPanel.getTotalHeight()));
471        else
472            sp = new SquidPanel(width, height, textFactory);
473        addActor(sp);
474        extraPanels.add(sp);
475        return this;
476    }
477
478    /**
479     * Sets the size of the text in the given layer  (but not the size of the cells) to the given width and height in
480     * pixels (which may be stretched by viewports later on, if your program uses them).
481     *
482     * @param layer the layer to affect; 0 is background, 1 is unused, 2 is foreground, 3 and higher are extra panels
483     * @param wide  the width of a glyph in pixels
484     * @param high  the height of a glyph in pixels
485     * @return this for chaining
486     */
487    public SquidLayers setTextSize(int layer, float wide, float high) {
488        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
489        switch (layer) {
490            case 0:
491                break;
492            case 1:
493                break;
494            case 2:
495                p = foregroundPanel;
496                break;
497            default:
498                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
499        }
500        p.setTextSize(wide, high);
501        return this;
502    }
503
504    /**
505     * Sets the size of the text in all layers (but not the size of the cells) to the given width and height in pixels
506     * (which may be stretched by viewports later on, if your program uses them).
507     *
508     * @param wide the width of a glyph in pixels
509     * @param high the height of a glyph in pixels
510     * @return this for chaining
511     */
512    public SquidLayers setTextSize(float wide, float high) {
513        textFactory.tweakHeight(high).tweakWidth(wide).initBySize();
514        setTextSize(0, wide, high);
515        setTextSize(2, wide, high);
516        for (int i = 0; i < extraPanels.size(); i++) {
517            setTextSize(i + 3, wide, high);
518        }
519        return this;
520    }
521
522
523    /**
524     * Place a char c into the foreground at position x, y, with the default color.
525     *
526     * @param x in grid cells.
527     * @param y in grid cells.
528     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
529     * @return this for chaining
530     */
531    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c) {
532        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c);
533        return this;
534    }
535
536    /**
537     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color as a libGDX Color (or SColor).
538     *
539     * @param x          in grid cells.
540     * @param y          in grid cells.
541     * @param c          a character to be drawn in the foreground
542     * @param foreground Color for the char being drawn
543     * @return this for chaining
544     */
545    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, Color foreground) {
546        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foreground);
547        return this;
548    }
549
550    /**
551     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color as a packed float.
552     *
553     * @param x                 in grid cells.
554     * @param y                 in grid cells.
555     * @param c                 a character to be drawn in the foreground
556     * @param encodedForeground float encoding the color for the char being drawn
557     * @return this for chaining
558     */
559    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, float encodedForeground) {
560        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, encodedForeground);
561        return this;
562    }
563
564    /**
565     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a specified foreground color and background color.
566     *
567     * @param x          in grid cells.
568     * @param y          in grid cells.
569     * @param c          a character to be drawn in the foreground
570     * @param foreground Color for the char being drawn
571     * @param background Color for the background
572     * @return this for chaining
573     */
574    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, Color foreground, Color background) {
575        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foreground);
576        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, background);
577        return this;
578    }
579
580    /**
581     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground and background libGDX Color and a lightness variation for
582     * the background (255 will make the background equal the background panel's
583     * {@link SquidPanel#getLightingColor()}, -255 will use the background as-is, and values in between will be
584     * linearly interpolated between those two extremes).
585     *
586     * @param x                   in grid cells.
587     * @param y                   in grid cells.
588     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
589     * @param foreground          Color for the char being drawn
590     * @param background          Color for the background
591     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are changed less, higher changed closer to the lighting color
592     * @return this for chaining
593     */
594    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, Color foreground, Color background, int backgroundLightness) {
595        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foreground);
596        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, background, (clamp(lightnesses[x][y] + 256 + backgroundLightness, 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f);
597        return this;
598    }
599
600    /**
601     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground and background libGDX Color and a lightness variation for
602     * the background (255 will make the background equal the background panel's
603     * {@link SquidPanel#getLightingColor()}, -255 will use the background as-is, and values in between will be
604     * linearly interpolated between those two extremes).
605     *
606     * @param x             in grid cells.
607     * @param y             in grid cells.
608     * @param c             a character to be drawn in the foreground
609     * @param foreground    Color for the char being drawn
610     * @param background    Color for the background
611     * @param mixAmount     int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are changed less, higher changed closer to mixBackground
612     * @param mixBackground Color to mix with the background, dependent on mixAmount
613     * @return this for chaining
614     */
615    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, Color foreground, Color background, int mixAmount, Color mixBackground) {
616        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foreground);
617        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, background,
618                (clamp(lightnesses[x][y] + 256 + mixAmount, 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f,
619                mixBackground);
620        return this;
621    }
622
623    /**
624     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground and background color each encoded as a packed float and a
625     * lightness variation for the background (255 will make the background equal the background panel's
626     * {@link SquidPanel#getLightingColor()}, -255 will use encodedBackground as-is, and values in between will be
627     * linearly interpolated between those two extremes).
628     *
629     * @param x                   in grid cells.
630     * @param y                   in grid cells.
631     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
632     * @param encodedForeground   float encoding the color for the char being drawn
633     * @param encodedBackground   float encoding the color for the background
634     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
635     * @return this for chaining
636     */
637    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, float encodedForeground, float encodedBackground, int backgroundLightness) {
638        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, encodedForeground);
639        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, encodedBackground,
640                (clamp(lightnesses[x][y] + 256 + backgroundLightness, 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f);
641        return this;
642    }
643
644    /**
645     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground, background, and mix color (which affects the background)
646     * each encoded as a packed float and a lightness variation for the background (255 will make the background equal
647     * mixColor, -255 will use encodedBackground as-is, and values in between will be linearly interpolated between
648     * those two extremes).
649     *
650     * @param x                   in grid cells.
651     * @param y                   in grid cells.
652     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
653     * @param encodedForeground   float encoding the color for the char being drawn
654     * @param encodedBackground   float encoding the color for the background
655     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
656     * @param mixBackground       float encoding a color to mix with the background instead of the normal lighting color
657     * @return this for chaining
658     */
659    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, float encodedForeground, float encodedBackground, int backgroundLightness, float mixBackground) {
660        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, encodedForeground);
661        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, encodedBackground,
662                (clamp(lightnesses[x][y] + 256 + backgroundLightness, 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f, mixBackground);
663        return this;
664    }
665
666    /**
667     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground, background, and mix color (which affects the background)
668     * each encoded as a packed float and a lightness variation for the background (using the style that SquidPanel
669     * does, with the "lightness" a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive, encodedBackground used on its own for 0
670     * lightness, mixBackground used on its own for 1 lightness, and values in between mixing the two).
671     *
672     * @param x                   in grid cells.
673     * @param y                   in grid cells.
674     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
675     * @param encodedForeground   float encoding the color for the char being drawn
676     * @param encodedBackground   float encoding the color for the background
677     * @param backgroundLightness float between 0.0f and 1.0f (both inclusive); higher means closer to mixBackground
678     * @param mixBackground       float encoding a color to mix with the background instead of the normal lighting color
679     * @return this for chaining
680     */
681    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, float encodedForeground, float encodedBackground, float backgroundLightness, float mixBackground) {
682        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, encodedForeground);
683        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, encodedBackground, backgroundLightness, mixBackground);
684        //        lightnesses[x][y] + (int) (backgroundLightness * 255), mixBackground);
685        return this;
686    }
687
688    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c) {
689        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c);
690        return this;
691    }
692
693    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, Color[][] foreground, Color[][] background) {
694        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foreground);
695        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, background);
696        return this;
697    }
698
699
700    /**
701     * Place a 2@ char array c into the foreground, with foreground colors specified by a 2D Color array, background
702     * colors with another 2D Color array, and lightness variations for the background in a 2D int array (255 will make
703     * the background equal the background panel's {@link SquidPanel#getLightingColor()}, -255 will use the background
704     * as-is, and values in between will be linearly interpolated between those two extremes).
705     *
706     * @param x                   in grid cells.
707     * @param y                   in grid cells.
708     * @param c                   char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
709     * @param foregrounds         Color[][] of colors for the char being drawn
710     * @param backgrounds         Color[][] of colors for the background
711     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
712     * @return this for chaining
713     */
714    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, Color[][] foregrounds, Color[][] backgrounds, int[][] backgroundLightness) {
715
716        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregrounds);
717        for (int i = x; i < getTotalWidth() && i - x < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
718            for (int j = y; j < getTotalHeight() && j - y < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++) {
719                backgroundPanel.put(i, j, backgrounds[i - x][j - y],
720                        (clamp(lightnesses[i][j] + 256 + backgroundLightness[i - x][j - y], 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f);
721            }
722        }
723        return this;
724    }
725
726
727    /**
728     * Place a char c into the specified layer, using the specified layer's default foreground color.
729     *
730     * @param layer 0 or 1 for background, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
731     * @param x     in grid cells.
732     * @param y     in grid cells.
733     * @param c     char to be drawn in the foreground at x, y
734     * @return this for chaining
735     */
736    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c) {
737        getLayer(layer).put(x, y, c);
738        return this;
739    }
740
741    /**
742     * Place a char c into the specified layer with the specified Color.
743     *
744     * @param layer the layer to draw into
745     * @param x     in grid cells.
746     * @param y     in grid cells.
747     * @param c     a character to be drawn in the specified layer
748     * @param color Color for the char being drawn
749     * @return this for chaining
750     */
751    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c, Color color) {
752        getLayer(layer).put(x, y, c, color);
753        return this;
754    }

756    /**
757     * Place a 2D char array c into the specified layer, using the specified layer's default foreground color.
758     *
759     * @param layer 0 or 1 for background, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
760     * @param x     in grid cells.
761     * @param y     in grid cells.
762     * @param c     char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
763     * @return this for chaining
764     */

766        getLayer(layer).put(x, y, c);
767        return this;
768    }

771     * Place a 2D char array c into the specified layer, using the matching Color from the given 2D Color array.
772     *
773     * @param layer  0 or 1 for background, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
774     * @param x      in grid cells.
775     * @param y      in grid cells.
776     * @param c      char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
777     * @param colors Color[][] that should have the same width and height as c
778     * @return this for chaining
779     */
780    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char[][] c, Color[][] colors) {
781        getLayer(layer).put(x, y, c, colors);
782        return this;
783    }

785    /**
786     * Put a string at the given x, y position, using the default foreground color.
787     *
788     * @param x in grid cells.
789     * @param y in grid cells.
790     * @param s the string to print
791     * @return this for chaining
792     */
793    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s) {
794        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s);
795        return this;
796    }
797
798    /**
799     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given foreground Color.
800     *
801     * @param x               in grid cells.
802     * @param y               in grid cells.
803     * @param s               the string to print
804     * @param foreground      the Color to use
805     * @return this, for chaining
806     */
807    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, Color foreground) {
808        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, foreground);
809        return this;
810    }
811
812    /**
813     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given foreground and background Colors.
814     *
815     * @param x          in grid cells.
816     * @param y          in grid cells.
817     * @param s          the string to print
818     * @param foreground the Color of the string's chars
819     * @param background the Color of the background of the string
820     * @return this, for chaining
821     */
822    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, Color foreground, Color background) {
823        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, foreground);
824        for (int i = x; i < x + s.length() && i < getTotalWidth(); i++) {
825            backgroundPanel.put(i, y, background);
826        }
827        return this;
828    }
829
830    /**
831     * A utility method that draws a 1-cell-wide black box around the text you request (as s) and replaces the contents
832     * of anything that was below or adjacent to the string's new position. Useful for message boxes.
833     *
834     * @param x in grid cells.
835     * @param y in grid cells.
836     * @param s the string to print inside the box
837     * @return this, for chaining
838     */
839    public SquidLayers putBoxedString(int x, int y, String s) {
840        if (y > 0 && y + 1 < getTotalHeight() && x > 0 && x + 1 < getTotalWidth()) {
841            for (int j = y - 1; j < y + 2 && j < getTotalHeight(); j++) {
842                for (int i = x - 1; i < s.length() + x + 2 && i < getTotalWidth(); i++) {
843                    foregroundPanel.put(i, j, ' ');
844                    lightnesses[i][j] = -200;
845
846                    backgroundPanel.put(i, j, backgroundPanel.getAt(i, j),
847                            SColor.DARK_GRAY, 0f * 0.001953125f);
848                }
849            }
850        }
851        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, SColor.CREAM);
852
853        return this;
854    }
855
856    /**
857     * Change the lightness for the background of the cell at x, y (0 is no change, 100 is
858     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
859     *
860     * @param x         in grid cells.
861     * @param y         in grid cells.
862     * @param lightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
863     */
864    public SquidLayers highlight(int x, int y, int lightness) {
865        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundPanel.getAt(x, y),
866                backgroundPanel.getColorAt(x, y),
867                (clamp(lightnesses[x][y] + 256 + lightness, 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f);
868        return this;
869    }
870
871    /**
872     * Change the lightness for the background of the cell at x, y (0 is no change, 100 is
873     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
874     *
875     * @param x         in grid cells.
876     * @param y         in grid cells.
877     * @param lightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
878     */
879    public SquidLayers highlight(int x, int y, int[][] lightness) {
880        for (int i = 0; i < lightness.length && x + i < getTotalWidth(); i++) {
881            for (int j = 0; j < lightness[i].length && y + j < getTotalHeight(); j++) {
882                backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundPanel.getAt(x, y),
883                        backgroundPanel.getColorAt(x, y), (clamp(lightnesses[x + i][y + j] + 256 + lightness[i][j], 1, 511)) * 0.001953125f);
884            }
885        }
886        return this;
887    }
888
889    /**
890     * Very basic check to see if something was rendered at the x,y cell requested; this only checks the
891     * foreground. If the foreground contains the character {@code ' '} at the given position or has not
892     * been assigned a value at that position, then this returns false, otherwise it returns true.
893     *
894     * @param x in grid cells.
895     * @param y in grid cells.
896     * @return true if something was rendered in the foreground at the given x,y position
897     */
898    public boolean hasValue(int x, int y) {
899        return foregroundPanel.getAt(x, y) != ' ';
900    }
901
902    /**
903     * Clear one cell at position x, y of  its foreground contents.
904     * <p>
905     * You may be looking for the erase() method, which erases all panels and all cells.
906     *
907     * @param x in grid cells
908     * @param y in grid cells
909     * @return this for chaining
910     */
911    public SquidLayers clear(int x, int y) {
912        foregroundPanel.clear(x, y);
913        return this;
914    }
915
916    public SquidLayers eraseLayer(int layer) {
917        getLayer(layer).erase();
918        return this;
919    }
920
921    /**
922     * Erase everything visible in all cells or all layers.  This is not at all expensive to do compared to the
923     * pre-SquidLib-3.0.0 version of this method that used Swing and took a long time to erase.
924     *
925     * @return this, for chaining
926     */
927    public SquidLayers erase() {
928        foregroundPanel.erase();
929        backgroundPanel.erase();
930        for (SquidPanel sp : extraPanels) {
931            sp.erase();
932        }
933        return this;
934    }

937        if (duration < 0)
938            duration = animationDuration;
939        getLayer(layer).bump(x, y, dir, duration);
940        return this;
941    }

947        return this;

1023
1024    public boolean hasActiveAnimations() {
1025        if (foregroundPanel.hasActiveAnimations())
1026            return true;
1027        if (backgroundPanel.hasActiveAnimations())
1028            return true;
1029        for (SquidPanel panel : extraPanels) {
1030            if (panel.hasActiveAnimations())
1031                return true;
1032        }
1033        return false;
1034    }

1132    public AnimatedEntity getAnimatedEntityByCell(int x, int y) {
1133        return foregroundPanel.getAnimatedEntityByCell(x, y);
1134    }
1135
1136    public void removeAnimatedEntityByCell(int x, int y, int layer) {
1137        getLayer(layer).removeAnimatedEntity(getAnimatedEntityByCell(x, y, layer));
1138    }
1139
1140    public void removeAnimatedEntityByCell(int x, int y) {
1141        foregroundPanel.removeAnimatedEntity(getAnimatedEntityByCell(x, y));
1142    }

1144    @Override
1145    public void draw(Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
1146        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
1147        super.draw(batch, parentAlpha);
1148    }

1151        getLayer(layer).drawActor(batch, parentAlpha, ae);
1152    }

1154    public void drawActor(Batch batch, float parentAlpha, AnimatedEntity ae) {
1155        foregroundPanel.drawActor(batch, parentAlpha, ae);
1156    }

1163        return backgroundPanel.getLightingColor();

1167    /**
1168     * Sets the position of the actor's bottom left corner.
1169     *
1170     * @param x
1171     * @param y
1172     */
1173    @Override
1174    public void setPosition(float x, float y) {
1175        //super.setPosition(x, y);
1176        //setBounds(x, y, getWidth(), getHeight());
1177        foregroundPanel.setPosition(x, y);
1178        backgroundPanel.setPosition(x, y);
1179        for (SquidPanel panel : extraPanels) {
1180            panel.setPosition(x, y);
1181        }
1182    }
1183
1184    /**
1185     * Gets a SquidPanel from this SquidLayers and returns a direct reference. Layer 0 is the background, layer 1 or 2
1186     * is the foreground, and any values 3 or higher are extra SquidPanels added via {@link #addExtraLayer()}.
1187     * If the layer is not found, this returns the foreground SquidPanel.
1188     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 or 2 for foreground, 3 for any extra layers; defaults to foreground
1189     * @return the corresponding SquidPanel as a direct reference
1190     */
1191    public SquidPanel getLayer(int layer) {
1192        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1193        switch (layer) {
1194            case 0:
1195                p = backgroundPanel;
1196                break;
1197            case 1:
1198            case 2:
1199                break;
1200            default:
1201                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1202        }
1203        return p;
1204    }
1205
1206    public SquidPanel getForegroundLayer() {
1207        return foregroundPanel;
1208    }
1209
1210    /**
1211     * Sets the foreground panel to match the given SquidPanel (it can also be a subclass of SquidPanel, a likely use).
1212     * This does not do any validation of size, but the {@link SquidPanel#getTotalWidth()} and
1213     * {@link SquidPanel#getTotalHeight()} of panel should almost always match this object's {@link #getTotalWidth()}
1214     * and {@link #getTotalHeight()}, though there are good reasons why the cell sizes or text sizes might not match.
1215     * This method is probably most useful when you want a system of {@link ImageSquidPanel} layers; as long as you have
1216     * the reference to an ImageSquidPanel outside this class, you can call its additional methods there and have it
1217     * affect {@code panel} here.
1218     *
1219     * @param panel a SquidPanel, ImageSquidPanel, or other subclass of SquidPanel that should have identical size
1220     */
1221    public void setForegroundLayer(SquidPanel panel) {
1222        if (panel != null) {
1223            removeActor(foregroundPanel);
1224            foregroundPanel = panel;
1225            addActorAt(2, panel);
1226
1227        }
1228    }
1229
1230    public SquidPanel getBackgroundLayer() {
1231        return backgroundPanel;
1232    }
1233
1234    /**
1235     * Sets the background panel to match the given SquidPanel (it can also be a subclass of SquidPanel, a likely use).
1236     * This does not do any validation of size, but the {@link SquidPanel#getTotalWidth()} and
1237     * {@link SquidPanel#getTotalHeight()} of panel should almost always match this object's {@link #getTotalWidth()}
1238     * and {@link #getTotalHeight()}, though there are good reasons why the cell sizes or text sizes might not match.
1239     * This method is probably most useful when you want a system of {@link ImageSquidPanel} layers; as long as you have
1240     * the reference to an ImageSquidPanel outside this class, you can call its additional methods there and have it
1241     * affect {@code panel} here.
1242     *
1243     * @param panel a SquidPanel, ImageSquidPanel, or other subclass of SquidPanel that should have identical size
1244     */
1245    public void setBackgroundLayer(SquidPanel panel) {
1246
1247        if (panel != null) {
1248            removeActor(backgroundPanel);
1249            backgroundPanel = panel;
1250            addActorAt(0, panel);
1251        }
1252    }
1253
1254    /**
1255     * Sets an extra panel to match the given SquidPanel (it can also be a subclass of SquidPanel, a likely use).
1256     * This tries to find the SquidPanel at the given index in the extra panels that may have been added to this with
1257     * {@link #addExtraLayer()}; if index is invalid because it is negative, this does nothing. If index is higher
1258     * than the highest index for a layer, this will simply add {@code panel} to the extra panels, possibly at an
1259     * earlier index (it will use the next available index, which could easily be 0 or 1). If index is valid, this sets
1260     * the extra panel at that index to {@code panel}, without changes.
1261     * This does not do any validation of size, but the {@link SquidPanel#getTotalWidth()} and
1262     * {@link SquidPanel#getTotalHeight()} of panel should almost always match this object's {@link #getTotalWidth()}
1263     * and {@link #getTotalHeight()}, though there are good reasons why the cell sizes or text sizes might not match.
1264     * This method is probably most useful when you want a system of {@link ImageSquidPanel} layers; as long as you have
1265     * the reference to an ImageSquidPanel outside this class, you can call its additional methods there and have it
1266     * affect {@code panel} here.
1267     *
1268     * @param panel a SquidPanel, ImageSquidPanel, or other subclass of SquidPanel that should have identical size
1269     * @param index the 0-based index into the extra panels list to try to assign panel to, or to append panel to
1270     */
1271
1272    public void setExtraPanel(SquidPanel panel, int index) {
1273        if (index < 0 || panel == null || extraPanels == null)
1274            return;
1275        if (index >= extraPanels.size()) {
1276            extraPanels.add(panel);
1277            addActor(panel);
1278        } else {
1279            removeActor(extraPanels.get(index));
1280            extraPanels.set(index, panel);
1281            addActorAt(index, panel);
1282        }
1283    }
1284
1285
1286    /**
1287     * Sets the IColorCenter used by the foreground layer.
1288     *
1289     * @param scc an IColorCenter<Color>; commonly a SquidColorCenter with an optional filter
1290     */
1291    public void setFGColorCenter(IColorCenter<Color> scc) {
1292        foregroundPanel.setColorCenter(scc);
1293    }
1294
1295    /**
1296     * Sets the IColorCenter used by the background layer.
1297     *
1298     * @param scc an IColorCenter<Color>; commonly a SquidColorCenter with an optional filter
1299     */
1300    public void setBGColorCenter(IColorCenter<Color> scc) {
1301        backgroundPanel.setColorCenter(scc);
1302    }
1303
1304    public void setOffsets(float x, float y) {
1305        foregroundPanel.setOffsets(x, y);
1306        backgroundPanel.setOffsets(x, y);
1307        for (SquidPanel p : extraPanels)
1308            p.setOffsets(x, y);
1309    }

1323            sp.setGridOffsetX(offset);

1328        backgroundPanel.setGridOffsetY(offset);
1329        for (SquidPanel sp : extraPanels)
1330            sp.setGridOffsetY(offset);
1331    }

1334        return foregroundPanel.getTotalWidth();
